rationale: The segment states factual outcomes (no human cases, one reported) without using an intensified or comparative risk-adjective.
statement_text: No human cases have been documented from this strain of the avian flu in the U.S., and only one has been reported in Europe, said Todd Davis, lead of the CDC's zoonotic virus team in virology surveillance.

rationale: The verbs 'documented' and 'reported' are neutral, and there is no high-potency language.
statement_text: No human cases have been documented from this strain of the avian flu in the U.S., and only one has been reported in Europe, said Todd Davis, lead of the CDC's zoonotic virus team in virology surveillance.

rationale: The segment contains reassuring language ('No human cases', 'only one'); 'documented' and 'reported' are not moderate verbs.
